identificationModule.briefTitle: Personalized Perioperative Analgesia Platform (PPAP) for Cesarean Section
identificationModule.officialTitle: Personalized Perioperative Analgesia Platform (PPAP) for Cesarean Section

collaborators.name: National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (NCATS)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this collaborative CTSA (Clinical and Translational Science Award) application is to develop an innovative perioperative precision analgesia platform (PPAP) to improve analgesia and reduce serious immediate and long-term adverse outcomes of perioperative opioids in breastfeeding mothers and their infants
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The approach includes 1) development and implementation of an innovative PPAP infrastructure at participating CTSA hubs (Aim 1) and 2) to improve analgesia and reduce serious immediate and long-term adverse outcomes of perioperative opioids and precision dosing in nursing mothers and infants (Aim 2).

SPECIFIC AIMS: The purpose of this collaborative CTSA application is to develop an innovative perioperative precision analgesia platform (PPAP) to improve analgesia and reduce serious immediate and long-term adverse outcomes of perioperative opioids in

Aim 1. Develop and implement a perioperative precision analgesia platform (PPAP) by linking genomics to opioid metabolism, Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation (CPIC) guidelines, precision dosing, clinical safety, and personalizing analgesia

Aim 2. Evaluate utility of PPAP in nursing mothers and their newborns following Cesarean Section The investigators hypothesize that CYP2D6 and other (ABCB1, and OPRM1) variants will explain clinical and pharmacokinetic variations of oxycodone, and PPAP implementation will reduce adverse effects in mothers and infants.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Interventional study with mother undergoing elective c-section and the infant

armGroups.label: Mother undergoing planned Cesarean section
armGroups.description: Mother subject will have genotyping blood draw performed at the time of controlled delivery (CD). Blood samples and breast milk samples will also be taken during the oxycodone dosing schedule.

armGroups.label: Infant
armGroups.description: Infant subject will have genotyping blood draw performed only at the time of controlled delivery (CD)

interventions.name: Preoperative Genotyping
interventions.description: Genotype based risk prediction and personalized pain management

primaryOutcomes.measure: Look at genetic factors predisposing patients to immediate postoperative opioid-adverse effects Respiratory Depression (RD) and Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV)
primaryOutcomes.description: The investigators will look at specific CYP2D6, ABCB1, FAAH, OPRM1, and COMT variants to find correlations with patients who experience RD and PONV in the immediate post-surgical period (4 days) in the hospital

primaryOutcomes.measure: Look at genetic factors predisposing patients to immediate postoperative opioid-adverse effects Respiratory Depression (RD) and Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV)
primaryOutcomes.description: The investigators will look at specific CYP2D6, ABCB1, FAAH, OPRM1, and COMT variants to find correlations with patients who experience RD and PONV in the post-surgical period at home up to 1-year
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At home up to 1 year post-surgery

primaryOutcomes.measure: Look at genetic factors predisposing patients to inadequate surgical pain relief with oxycodone
primaryOutcomes.description: The investigators will look at specific CYP2D6, ABCB1, FAAH, OPRM1, and COMT variants to find correlations with patients who experience poor pain relief in the immediate post-surgical period (4 days) in the hospital. Poor pain relief will be measured using the Numerical Rating Scale (NRS), which runs on a 0-10 scale; 0 being no pain at all, 10 being the worst pain imaginable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Look at genetic factors predisposing patients to inadequate surgical pain relief with oxycodone
primaryOutcomes.description: The investigators will look at specific CYP2D6, ABCB1, FAAH, OPRM1, and COMT variants to find correlations with patients who experience poor pain relief in the post-surgical period at home up to 1-year. Poor pain relief will be measured using the Numerical Rating Scale (NRS), which runs on a 0-10 scale; 0 being no pain at all, 10 being the worst pain imaginable.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At home up to 1 year post-surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Look at the impact of CYP2D6 variants on oxycodone's clinical dosing in patients to see if specific variants correlate with a need for lower or higher doses of analgesic.
secondaryOutcomes.description: The investigators will look at CYP2D6 variants to find correlations in oxycodone's PK sampling and the need for dose adjustments that lead to desired clinical outcomes in women undergoing a cesarean section and their infant.

otherOutcomes.measure: Look at OPRM1 epigenetics and OPRM1, FAAH, GCH1, DRD2 variants to find correlations with chronic persistent surgical pain (CPSP) up to 1-year post-surgery
otherOutcomes.description: Patients will be asked to complete psychological questionnaires post-surgery to assess psycho-psychological factors that may correlate with CPSP. CPSP is defined as pain that develops after a surgical procedure and lasts at least 3 months and significantly affects health-related quality of life.

otherOutcomes.measure: Look at OPRM1 epigenetics and OPRM1, FAAH, GCH1, DRD2 variants to find correlations with opioid dependence (OD) up to 1-year post-surgery
otherOutcomes.description: Patients will be asked to complete psychological questionnaires post-surgery to assess psycho-psychological factors that may correlate with opioid dependence (OD). OD will be determined using the validated Sophia Observation Withdrawal Symptoms Scale (SOS). The SOS is based on a 15-point scale.

otherOutcomes.measure: Look at OPRM1 epigenetics and OPRM1, FAAH, GCH1, DRD2 variants to find correlations with opioid dependence (OD) up to 1-year post-surgery
otherOutcomes.description: Patients will be asked to complete psychological questionnaires post-surgery to assess psycho-psychological factors that may correlate with opioid dependence (OD). OD will be determined using the Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS). The COWS is based on a scale with a minimum score of 5 and maximum score of 48; 5-12 = mild, 13-24 = moderate, 25-36 = moderately severe, more than 36 = severe withdrawal

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Adult women (\>18 yr) All races American Society of Anesthesiologists Classification (ASA) physical status: 1 to 3 undergoing elective Cesarean section that are willing to receive in-patient opioids.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Health conditions including uncontrolled diabetes (gestational or pre-existing) or hypertension (pre-eclampsia, eclampsia, or chronic)
2. Any history of opioid misuse before or during pregnancy-per self-report and clinical notes
3. Preoperative severe pain and opioid use/misuse, allergy to oxycodone
4. Allergy to oxycodone
5. Significant neurological disorders, liver and renal diseases

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: No current IPD sharing plan anticipated
